contents.contents:
we’ve built in a task tracker. was that sensible? questionable.

the future plans will be to use git-bug to store the data, which syncs with github and others and I don’t want to duplicate that. maybe once we support that we can read from their bug store.

but that’s also because we want to have relationships like ‘blocking’ and ‘blocked by’

and in some cases we’d like to point at bugs across multiple systems and link to them and track relationships between them since the whole universe isn’t on github.

and this is more about project management and keeping track of many things going on in many places, providing documentation, building a roadmap from that.

but the whole world is on github. this is a very high bar to try and clear and it isn’t my core desire.

i just wanted it to be easier to track shitty lil things like “thesis” tasks for which issues are extremely ‘heavy’ and there’s a rapidly shifting timeline. github issues hasn’t been great for ‘project’ management tasks either (tracking things like project overviews, links to google docs, etc.) there’s a reason i went to notion
